attributes.action: Ensure that hard dance music gets some TV airtime.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Acidtv is a cutting-edge youth-culture-music-TV show which plays primarily hard dance, hardstyle and hardcore with live visuals/VJing and exclusive live mixes from top name DJs.

Our host channel recently ceased broadcasting but the relentless emails of support from our viewers have made us realise we're sitting on top of a bigger issue, and have spurred us on to try and find a new home for Hard Dance on TV.

This petition is set up so that our viewers can sign their names to preserve the last bastion of what is effectively the only airtime this minority-music/culture-segment ever sees. It is open to anyone who places value on culturally diverse music broadcasts.

The .gov has given us this medium to show support for things we feels strongly about - this is a valid youth-culture issue, Help Us.


This specifically *isn't* just about us or our brand this is about us trying to preserve a way of life.

Sign your name and preserve the hardcore.


P*L*U*R,

the AcidTV crew.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
